reasoning: Three related SQLAlchemy models with relationships, bilingual fields, and JSONB columns. Contained to 1-2 files in backend service with no external integrations. Standard ORM work but requires careful relationship design.

scope.notes: Primary file: backend/app/models/checklist_template.py (new). May need to update backend/app/models/__init__.py to import new models. Contained to backend service only.

integrations.notes: Pure internal model work using existing SQLAlchemy. No external APIs or services involved.

infrastructure.notes: Will create new PostgreSQL tables via Alembic migration. Uses JSONB datatype (PostgreSQL-specific). No Docker/compose changes or new environment variables needed.

knowledge.notes: SQLAlchemy is standard ORM technology. Need to check existing model patterns in codebase for consistency (UUID primary keys, relationship setup, timestamp fields).

concerns: Data model correctness - relationships must be properly bidirectional
JSONB field handling (file_names array, additional_config dict)
Cascade delete behavior for hierarchical relationships
risk.notes: Models form foundation for checklist features. Incorrect relationships or field types would require future migrations. Medium risk due to foundational nature, but no security/payment concerns.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: New database models with relationships and JSONB fields require both unit tests for field behavior and integration tests for database operations and relationship queries.
